frameDefinitions: A fire which burns and requires an emergency-type response.
In this frame the Patient, an inorganic item, undergoes a chemical process which renders it less useful, desirable or stable. '' '
In this frame, a Resource_controller is judged by a Judge (who is usually implicit)  according to how freely they allow the Recipient access to their Resource.
Under some Condition, usually left implicit, a Responsible_party is required to perform some Duty.
The Fastener is an artifact created to close a Container (e.g. coat, jar).
An Item comes to be attached to a Goal, with a Connector forming a bond between the Handle of the Item and the Goal (or some part of it).
frameExamples: It is my <t>duty</t> to fight any attack on the Brotherhood .
The door <t>seal</t> prevented air from getting in and the kids' screams from getting out.
According to plan, the front part of the hull quietly <t>attached</t> to the docking gear.
listRoleDefinitions: The total material currently involved in combustion, including both the parts of the Fuel currently undergoing chemical alteration and the partially ionized gas that results from this process.
The entity that is undergoing rapid chemical alteration leading to damage or destruction.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fire</fen> is burning.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Fire</fen> is burning.
The <fen>Patient</fen> undergoes a change.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Patient</fen> corrodes.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Patient</fen> corrodes.
The Resource_Controller is the individual who controls access to the Resource.
The Resource_controller controls the Recipient's access to the Resource.
The <fen>Recipient</fen> is the individual or individuals who receive or should receive the <fen>Resource</fen> from the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
The Behavior is an action of the Resource_controller which is judged to be generous or stingy.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The time interval during which the Responsibly_party is obligated to fulfill the Duty.
A location in which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> has a specified <fen>Duty</fen> .
This role identifies the item that is closed with the <fen>Fastener</fen>.
The artifact created to close a <fen>Container</fen>.
This role identifies the active zone of the container where the <fen>Fastener</fen> is located.
<fen>Connector</fen> identifies the  instrument used to attach, usually in a <ment>with</ment>-PP.
<fen>Item</fen> identifies the entity that comes to be attached to the <fen>Goal</fen>.
<fen>Items</fen> identifies the plural items that are tied together, resulting in their mutual attachment.
<fen>Goal</fen> identifies the location to which the first <fen>Item</fen> is attached.
The time when the attaching event takes place.
The location where the attaching event takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The bikes</fex> rusted from their former beauty.
Surprising, Dad was stingy <fex>with his inheritance</fex>.
Mr. Burns is extremely miserly <fex>towards his employees</fex>.
It was generous of Jim <fex>to have us over for dinner</fex>.
My job is <fex>to get to the other side of the bridge</fex>.
<fex>At that time</fex> men were obligated to marry women from their own community.
I almost forgot to tell you that <fex>in Sweden</fex> we are obligated to spend atleast 7.5 months in the army for training.
On Friday night, many men will simply elect to remove their tie and unbutton their top <fex>shirt</fex> button.
Man, I have just bought the exact same belt <fex><t>buckle</t></fex> and it won't open.
We couldn't close the <fex>tent flap</fex> zipper and a lot of flies came in .
The remoras attach to the whale <fex>with their strong jaws</fex>.
The remoras attach <fex>to the underside of the whale</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Menai Bridge Community Heritage Trust
